title: Error message when mean(0) on empty cuda tensor is misleading
body_html:
Issue description

CUDA Tensor seems not to check the shape of tensor in mean() function. torch.tensor([]).cuda().mean(0) should throw "invalid dimension 0" not to mislead.

Code example

When I do this on CPU:

>>> torch.tensor([]).mean(0)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 2: invalid dimension 0 at /Users/qbx2/pytorch/aten/src/TH/generic/THTensorMath.c:3897

When I do this on GPU:

>>> torch.tensor([]).cuda().mean(0)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 2: out of range at /Users/qbx2/pytorch/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensor.c:23

Without specifying dimension:

>>> torch.tensor([]).cuda().mean()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 1: empty Tensor at /Users/qbx2/pytorch/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensorMathReduce.cu:305

System Info

## Issue description

CUDA Tensor seems not to check the shape of tensor in mean() function. `torch.tensor([]).cuda().mean(0)` should throw "invalid dimension 0" not to mislead.

## Code example

When I do this on CPU:
```
>>> torch.tensor([]).mean(0)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 2: invalid dimension 0 at /Users/qbx2/pytorch/aten/src/TH/generic/THTensorMath.c:3897
```

### When I do this on GPU:
```
>>> torch.tensor([]).cuda().mean(0)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 2: out of range at /Users/qbx2/pytorch/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensor.c:23
```

### Without specifying dimension:
```
>>> torch.tensor([]).cuda().mean()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 1: empty Tensor at /Users/qbx2/pytorch/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensorMathReduce.cu:305
```
